CatDescriptText: Mrs. Morris Gaddie, housewife, St. Clair Village and Ivory Shivers, taxicab driver, Hill District, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think voters will choose the Republican or the Democratic candidate for the presidency?"  Mrs. Gaddie's answer reads: "I think there will be a Democratic President because the country prospers better under the Democrats.  That party always has been for the working man.""  Mr. Shivers' answer reads: "Democratic, because times have been hard under the Republicans."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. Morris Gaddie wearing eyeglasses, light colored cap, and light colored belted overcoat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ivory Shivers wearing Peoples Cab cap, standing on Liberty Avenue, Downtown
